#summary Old JSONpp top-level

JSONpp is a small, liberally accepting JSON parser for C++. The parser is written generically, so it operates with any algebraic data type which satisfies all the sub-types required by the JSON specification. As a default a `boost::variant` is supplied that meets these qualifications. The default sub-types are:
||*JSON type*||*JSONpp default type*||
||string||`std::wstring`||
||number||`double`||
||object||`std::map<std::wstring,VAL>`||
||array||`std::vector<VAL>`||
||true,false||`bool`||
||null||`struct nil {};`||

Where `VAL` is the recursive type of the `boost::variant`.
